channel.title: Podcast of the Dragon: An Analysis of the Wheel of Time
channel.description: With emotion and empathy, bursts of humor and a fair few F-bombs, this spoilery topical literary analysis of Robert Jordan's fantasy series looks at characters, themes, plots, scenes and other Wheel of Time subjects while following the path of the story. For fans familiar with the books looking for something different. (Expect full spoilers, including references from New Spring, WoT Companion, Wiki, Dragonmount, Theoryland, etc.)

item.title: 5/44: What Will Be
item.description:
Morgan looks at Mat's story in the Fires of Heaven, and doesn't snicker once when reading about combatants taking each other from behind.

item.title: 4/36: A Time of Flux and Destruction
item.description:
What do Aiel and Americans have in common? Morgan has opinions. Spears on bucklers as she wraps up the Shadow Rising with an exploration of Aiel identity, and a shepherd’s trip through a sparkle forest and early morning walk through the desert. (CW for brief mentions of sexual assault)

item.title: 3/22: Once the Dagger Sets His Path
item.description:
It’s time to talk about Mat! Morgan is ready to explore our lovable rogue throughout the Dragon Reborn -- but before we hear it from the man himself, she looks at the person we all thought we knew...(yes, this is part 1 of 2!)
Click the link to hear Morgan join Seth and Aradia of WoT Spoilers to discuss Crown of Swords Ch. 13! https://wotspoilers.com/wheel-of-time-spoilers-358-cos-ch-13-the-bowl-of-the-winds?tdest_id=2018075
Do you love the Leafcast? Of course you do! Click this link to watch Morgan join the lovable puppets for Tavern Talk: https://youtu.be/irpGgB_TTOM. She shows up at approx. 1 hr, 18 min, plays "WoT Name, Pharmaceutical, or Italian Town" with Vance @redhandbard, and discusses Seanchan moral relativism and her unpublished, hidden-in-a-drawer novel, among other titillating topics!
Please support the show! https://www.patreon.com/user?u=51381686
https://twitter.com/PodOfTheDragon?s=09

item.title: 3/18: Falcon Favors the Bold
item.description:
Morgan starts The Dragon Reborn by looking at Perrin's changes. Why is he waving away the wolves? What's motivating his choices? From his growing formidability to his burgeoning ta'veren nature, she examines how it comes to be that, while Moiraine was focused on Rand, the quiet one left a pile of bloody Whitecloaks that forced the crew to flee in the night.

Morgan starts The Dragon Reborn by looking at Perrin's changes. Why is he waving away the wolves? What's motivating his choices? item.title: 2/11: Someone Else's Crazy
item.description:
Morgan takes a break from making fun of Rand and spends an episode empathizing with him. She explores how much it sucks to go to someone wanting a hug and getting the psychological equivalent of being made to run laps until you puke instead, and looks at a bunch of other things that suck. Honestly, most things in Rand's life suck... (CW for discussion of mental illness and suicide/suicidal ideation.)

item.title: 2/9: The Great Kickoff
item.description:
The Hunt doesn't launch until chapter ten, so Morgan explores up through chapter 9 and examines RJ's use of juxtaposition in his world-building. If she had known pre-recording that there's a literary device called "juxtaposition" that succinctly describes what she's talking about, she would have used it a whole bunch. Sounding smarter would help make up for the fact that she says Padan Fain's initials are F.P.

item.title: 1/8: The Breast of the World
item.description:
From the Karaethon Cycle:
"He will be born to the ones chill with nudity, but raised by ones super uptight.
And there will come a time when he needs power that's easy to consume and won't hurt his tummy.
And you must place it in a vessel, and call it an Eye, because he won't recognize a breast."
Watch Morgan be awkward! Click the link to see her livestream on the Twotcast Charity Podcastathon! She shows up at about 39:50. https://youtu.be/opRgrHkuBFs. Then go to https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/thewheeloftime and give something to help combat cyberbullying (and help Morgan save face for being bad at a-thon-ing).

item.title: 1/2: There Are No Therapists in Randland
item.description:
Why lead into a solemn episode about our heroes' trauma with humorous show notes and an irreverent intro? For the same reason Aiel think it's funny when a woman accidentally stabs her husband -- if you can't laugh, you cry. Follow Morgan on an empathy exercise as she tries to know the troubles our characters have seen up through the night in Shadar Logoth.

item.title: 1/1: The Hook and Other Refinements
item.description:
Today's game is "drink every time Morgan says shit". (Only sip, or you'll pass out before episode's end). She'll try to offset it by saying smart things like "literary devices" waaay too many times, and then compare Emond's Fielders to Hobbits. In the process she'll discuss the 1st 5 chapters of the Eye of the World with an eye (heh) toward Jordan's world (groan) building.
Music by Kevin MacLeod
